bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Lien on property of guest and enforcement by sale

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Every innkeeper, boarding house keeper and lodging house keeper

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
has a lien on the baggage and property of a guest, boarder or lodger for the
            value or price of food or accommodation furnished to the guest, boarder or lodger,
            and

bcl:text:
in addition to all other remedies provided by law, has the right, in case the
            value or price of food or accommodation furnished to the guest, boarder or lodger
            remains unpaid for 3 months, to sell the baggage and property of the guest, boarder or
            lodger by public auction on giving one week's notice by advertisement

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
in a newspaper published in the electoral district in which the inn, boarding
              house or lodging house is located, or,

in case there is no newspaper published in the electoral district, in a
              newspaper published in British Columbia nearest to the inn, boarding house or lodging
              house

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: name of the guest, boarder or lodger,
description of the baggage or other property to be sold,
time and place of sale, and

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
After the sale the innkeeper, boarding house keeper or lodging house
          keeper

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may apply the proceeds of the sale in payment of the amount due and the costs of
            the advertising and sale, and

must pay over the surplus, if any, to the person entitled to it, if the person

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Limitation of liability for property of guest

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
No innkeeper is liable to make good to a guest loss of or injury to goods or
          property brought to the inn, except if the goods or property have been

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
stolen, lost or injured through the wilful act, default or neglect of the
            innkeeper or the innkeeper's servant, or

deposited expressly for safe custody with the innkeeper, except that in case of
            the deposit the innkeeper may require as a condition of liability that the goods or
            property be deposited in a box or other receptacle, fastened and sealed by the person
            depositing the goods or property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the vehicle of a guest has been delivered to the custody of the innkeeper or
          the innkeeper's servant expressly for storage or parking in a place specifically reserved
          and designated by the innkeeper for the storing or parking of vehicles, the liability of
          the innkeeper is that of a bailee for reward.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Liability for refusal or failure to take charge of goods
bcl:section.bcl:text:
If an innkeeper refuses to receive for safe custody, as mentioned, goods or property
        of a guest, or if a guest, through a default of the innkeeper, is unable to deposit the
        goods or property, the innkeeper is not entitled to the benefit of this Act for the loss of
        or injury to the goods or property unless the innkeeper proves that the inn was not equipped
        with a proper safe or vault or did not have a place for the storing or parking of vehicles
        and that the innkeeper informed the guest at the time of refusing or failing to receive the
        goods or property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of law to be conspicuously posted in rooms of inn

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Every innkeeper must keep conspicuously posted in the office and public rooms and
          in every bedroom in the inn a copy of section 3, printed in plain type.

An innkeeper is entitled to the benefit of section 3 for the goods or property
          brought to the inn only while the copies are posted.
